summary: This document is an email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys in the Ghislaine Maxwell case regarding discovery issues. It discusses technical problems with providing discovery materials to Maxwell at MDC, metadata questions about files from Epstein's devices, and coordination on evidence production.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C., representing Ghislaine Maxwell. She is corresponding with prosecutors about discovery issues, specifically requesting metadata and file format information for the SUPP production.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell. He initiates the email chain raising multiple discovery issues regarding file access, metadata, and missing attachments.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York involved in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. He is responding to defense discovery requests and coordinating with paralegals and vendors.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on discovery-related correspondence between the defense and prosecution teams.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, referenced as being held at MDC and having difficulty accessing discovery materials on prison computers.

connections.description: Co-defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, collaborating on discovery issues and corresponding with prosecutors.
Defense attorney and prosecutor corresponding about discovery production and technical issues in the Maxwell case.
Defense attorney and prosecutor discussing metadata and file format issues regarding evidence from Epstein's devices.
Defendant and her defense attorney, with Everdell working to ensure Maxwell can access discovery materials while incarcerated.
Prosecutor handling the case against the defendant, coordinating discovery production to the defense.

events.title: Discovery Production Coordination
events.description: Prosecution informs defense that additional discovery production is ready to be sent via USAfx and FedEx to MDC, including materials related to SUPP production.

events.title: Defense Raises Discovery Issues
events.description: Christian Everdell sends detailed list of discovery problems to prosecution including hard drive access for Maxwell, unreadable files, missing attachments, and metadata questions.

events.title: Searches of Epstein Residences
events.description: FBI conducted searches of Jeffrey Epstein's residences in 2019, recovering CDs containing images that were later produced as discovery.

events.title: November 2020 Discovery Production
events.description: Prosecution produced discovery including images from CDs seized during 2019 searches of Epstein residences, referenced as SDNY011 production.

keyFacts: Defense attorneys raised significant technical issues with discovery, including over 109,000 emails produced without attachments and over 110,000 electronic documents with questionable metadata dates.
Prosecution explained that files carved or deleted from Epstein's devices had no recoverable metadata, and images from CDs seized in 2019 searches didn't have CART numbers.
Ghislaine Maxwell had difficulty accessing discovery at MDC because prison computers couldn't read some file formats on provided disks.
The email chain reveals ongoing coordination problems between prosecution and defense regarding how to deliver discovery materials to Maxwell while she was incarcerated.
Prosecution referenced materials from 'SDFL or PBPD investigations' suggesting evidence came from multiple law enforcement agencies beyond SDNY.
